name: Narrow Gauge Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in May of this year. Highway 41 is at the southern end of Yosemite, closer to Mariposa Grove and the Inn is about an hours drive from Yosemite Valley. As we wanted to spend a full week exploring both the better and lesser known parts of Yosemite and the surrounding area, the location was perfect and the Narrow Gauge Inn seemed pretty good value.
reviews.title: Full of rustic charm and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn itself is charming and rustic and the staff very friendly. It's a quiet location, at least in May, and the Inn was not fully occupied during the week, which suited us just fine. Couple of highlights were some lovely cooked breakfasts and, on lazier mornings, getting woken up by the sound of the steam engine just down the road being readied for it's 10am first journey.
reviews.title: Clean, with old school charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all, thoroughly enjoyable stay - definitely somewhere we'd recommend for a peaceful stay near Yosemite that's away from the crowds
reviews.title: Great Inn -- definitely recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at Narrow Gauge for two nights on our trip to Yosemite. We unfortunately had one of the much older rooms in the original part of the motel, and as such they were down one large flight of stairs from the main car park - not great if you're older or travelling with children. Also, these rooms have paper thin walls - so much so that we could hear EVERYTHING in the room next door!
reviews.title: Wonderful Home Base for Yosemite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You get your own 'private' deck outside your room, but it's not private as such as people accessing the restaurant walk though your deck. That said, we enjoyed a pizza and wine on the deck one evening and the view was pretty spectacular.
reviews.title: Relaxing getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel because very close to south entrance to Yosemite but would recommend it having visited for a comfortable stay
reviews.title: Cosy hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are good sized with balcony..but it is the helpful staff who make this place a find
reviews.title: Amazing stay at this cute little fairytale place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shane in the bar always very friendly and welcoming and loved the hunting lodge style of the bar and restaurant. Pool and hot tub very welcome after a hot days hiking and we had the bonus of a MG owners club who stayed and drove off on Sat morning in their vintage cars
reviews.title: The views and the location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good breakfasts and nice dinner on one evening in the dining room
reviews.title: Somewhere a little different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a “conventional” and /or “modern” type of hotel, look somewhere else, but if you want to be near nature in beautiful and peaceful surroundings this is your place. .
reviews.title: Mission Inn Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The room we stayed (5 people) was huge and quite comfortable, with a balcony to the forest around it, but furnished in an unconventional way , you need to be open minded about it.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at the edge of Yosemite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are located in 3 levels, and you should choose the lowest one, which is furthest from the road and also from some noisy machine located on the back of the restaurant.
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is very friendly and efficient. There is a small swimming pool and a hot tub, but those are open only part of the year.
reviews.title: Great rustic inn..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I spent 2 nights at The Narrow Gauge Inn as part of a weekend visit to the Yosemite National Park during July. We had tried for accomodation in the park but due to the peak season all was booked and by visiting the Tripadvisor website came across this property. As far as location goes, it is a short drive on the main road ( Highway 41) into the Southern park entrance. Located in a lush forest surrounding it is well placed to be able to visit the Mariposa Grove , famous for it Giant Sequoia trees as well as access to the rest of the main attractions in the park. The inn had a very homely feel and although rooms were simple, they were comfortable, clean and had a great wireless internet connection as well as shower and comfortable dressing/bathroom. A wooden deck balcony looked over the lower parking area towards the forest surrounds. The service was very good and I particularly must mention the excellent quality of food and service in the dining room. The reception area has a lovely garden infront and the one can also buy souvenirs at the INN store. As we had 2 nights, we would drive into the park early and return later at night. Bear in mind that there will be a considerable amount of driving involved from the Mariposa Grove to Glacier point and then to Yosemite Village. However is well planned once can get to see all the main attractions in a weekend as we did. I would certainly come back to the Inn again , maybe next time combining it with a night or 2 within the park and closer to Yosemite Village.
reviews.title: Quaint and comfortable Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decoration is nice and warm, the outdoor terrain is unnecessary since we came back late. But breakfast was great, we ordered scrambled eggs with sausage.
reviews.title: love here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a little farther than the Tenaya lodge Yosemite to the South gate, but the rate is much lower here. Receptionists and waitress are lovely.
reviews.title: Location is great, basic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: In short, it is worthwhile.
reviews.title: Excellent welcome and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in July '12. We mostly selected this hotel because it was very close to the south entrance to Yosemite Park. The room was basic but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was outdated and it was annoying having to call the front desk to borrow a hairdryer. The free breakfast was very nice with many cold and hot options available and the dinner was delicious yet expensive for what you received. The restaurant was not open the first night we were there which was a pain...we had to drive about 30 mins back into town to eat (El Cid---awesome Mexican food!). Overall I would recommend this hotel especially if you are planning on visiting Yosemite.
reviews.title: 50th Wedding Anniversary

description: Charming 26 room Inn located 4 miles from Yosemite's South entrance. This pet friendly Inn has a seasonal fine dining restaurant, pool and hot tub. Spend time in the beautiful gardens or ride the historic Railroad, just next door.
